channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Dunedin line charges could increase $500 a year
item.description: There are fears Aurora Energy's $400 million upgrade to its network will disproportionately affect those least able to afford it.

item.title: Police Commissioner: 'High threshold' for routine use of armed police
item.description: Police Commissioner Andrew Coster says there would have to be a "very high threshold" to move towards a position of routine arming of police.

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 27 May
item.description: Nearly a billion dollars in cashflow loans has been paid out to small businesses hit by the economic fallout of Covid-19. Follow our blog for the latest.

item.title: Recreational fishers dispute effectiveness of new blue cod rules
item.description: Recreational fishers say changes to blue cod fishing rules will be largely ineffective because they don't target the commercial sector.

item.title: Covid-19 vaccine two years away, but NZ can do it - research head
item.description: A Covid-19 vaccine is the Everest of medicine, and the race is on to beat corporate interests to the top of the mountain, Professor Graham Le Gros from Malaghan Institute says.

item.title: Around the room in 70 days: NZer's lockdown in hotel
item.description: For some New Zealand travellers it has been a struggle to get home under Covid-19 travel restrictions, but for one man in Wellington it has been impossible to leave.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in NZ and around the world on 26 May
item.description: No new cases of Covid-19 were reported, the government funded vaccine research, Dr Bloomfield was confident of contact tracing, and Tourism Holdings cut 140 jobs.

item.title: Covid-19 unemployment pay 'real kick in the gut', beneficiaries say
item.description: Beneficiaries are angry the government is treating them differently to people who have lost their jobs because of the pandemic.

item.title: New restaurant forges ahead with opening
item.description: Covid-19 restrictions have seen scores of restaurants around the country close their doors for good, but one is going ahead with its plans to open for the first time.

item.title: Children and teachers taking time to adjust to school again
item.description: Excited but exhausted - that's how students are finding returning to the classroom a week after the lockdown.

item.title: Minister welcomes 'robust feedback' on app from sight impaired
item.description: The Minister for Disabilities will not say if the Health Ministry has breached government guidelines with its Covid-19 contact tracing app.

item.title: Gang boss' shooter sentenced to seven years
item.description: A man who shot and wounded the president of the Killer Beez gang outside a Harley Davidson shop in Auckland has been jailed for seven years.

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates in New Zealand and around the world on 26 May
item.description: Two Sydney schools have been closed after students tested positive for Covid-19. Read back through the day's events on RNZ's live blog.

item.title: New Zealand border closure leaves immigrants 'living like nomads' overseas
item.description: Immigrants locked out of the country by the border closure are vowing to pay for quarantine in empty hotels so that they can return to their lives in New Zealand.

item.title: EQC error leads to information on thousands of claims leaked
item.description: The Earthquake Commission has apologised after inadvertently releasing information from thousands of claims to a customer and their lawyer.

item.title: Bill banning smoking in cars with children inside passes
item.description: A bill banning smoking in cars carrying children has passed its final reading with support from all parties.

item.title: Kaimoana distributed to iwi through collaboration with Sealord, Moana
item.description: M훮ori fishing companies have been providing heavily discounted fish to iwi, to support wh훮nau during the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Firewood for wh훮nau plan clears wood left from lockdown
item.description: A Hauraki iwi initiative to provide firewood deliveries could keep wh훮nau homes warmer this winter.
